comment.author: 54968992@N03
comment._content:
Brilliant. I get goose bumps looking at this even though I never heard a recording of Collins, his charisma shines through the photo!
Great shot!

comment.author: 29460032@N07
comment._content: wooow! amazing :D

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03] In the 1950's I remember Dev coming to Limerick for a General Election.  The stand was at the O'Connell monument at the Crescent and you couldn't walk up O'Connell Street or down O'Connell Avenue the crowds were so big.  Many election meetings were very big right up to the late 60's until the troubles made them dangerous for all and sundry.  I saw similar meetings in and around Dublin in the '60's and '70's but there were fewer hats and caps on display then!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Has nobody spotted where this photo was taken? Grand Parade, Cork. The Tract and Book Society is now Amplifon. maps.google.co.uk/maps?q=cork&hl=en&ll=51.896884,...

comment.author: 13111789@N00
comment._content: Isn't it a shame that photos of this ilk are no longer taken and printed for future genrations to find for posterity but any current snaps will be lost in discarded hard drives .... Great shot .. iconic moment

comment._content: It's the Grand Parade alright .. The podium is probably in front of the now Bishop Lucey Park ..i reckon

comment.author: 59941010@N06
comment._content: I love it.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47290943@N03]  There were hecklers alright though it could be a dangerous game as tempers could fray.  There was a General Election shortly after I came to Dublin and one heckler got stuck into the Minister for Local Government at the time.  He didn't reckon on the Minister hitting him a few good thumps and sending him flying.  NB some of the people who occupy places of power in the current government were involved in such activity during their "radical" youth!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Well that's certainly a lively version of the cliché: A frank exchange of views!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
